Go Weekly

Interactive Release Notes for Go 1.23 ‚Äî If you find traditional release notes hard going, this interactive alternative with inline executable code snippets might help you get a grip on some of 1.23's changes before the final release next¬†month.

Anton Zhiyanov

üí° While we're on the topic.. Go 1.23 Release Candidate 2 has been¬†released.

First Impressions of Go 1.23's Range-over-Func Feature ‚Äî When the author read Go‚Äôs newest iteration proposal, he felt a bit intimidated, but decided to kick the tires and share his experiences. Now? He loves¬†it!

Jonathan Hall

Run GitHub Actions Up to 2x Faster at Half the¬†Cost ‚Äî Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like GitBook, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code¬†faster.

Blacksmith sponsor

Hash-Based Bisect Debugging in Compilers and Runtimes ‚Äî If you‚Äôve ever had to debug a large set of changes as part of an unfamiliar code base, this approach may feel like magic, so much so that Russ and others have created a CLI (bisect) to make the task easier. The explanation of using binary search, git bisect, and the bisect CLI here are very¬†informative.

Russ Cox

Ô£ø¬†How I Build Simple Mac Apps using Go ‚Äî The creator of DarwinKit, a set of native Apple APIs for Go, shows off how he uses it to create basic Mac¬†apps.

Jeff Lindsay

Live Website Updates with Go, SSE, and HTMX ‚Äî Showing real-time updates on a site may steer you toward WebSockets, but going the SSE (Server-Sent Events) route with HTMX provides a solid and simpler experience.

Mi≈Çosz Sm√≥≈Çka

Safeguarding Changes using the Plan-Execute Pattern ‚Äî A pattern used by tools like Terraform where a preview of changes is shown before applying them. Tom creates a simple example of importing data into a database while highlighting new, changed, and removed¬†entities.

Tom Nick

üìÑ gRPC Over HTTP/3 ‚Äì Complete with practical examples in¬†Go. Kevin McDonald

üìÑ Calling Go Functions from C++ Matteo / xnacly

üõ† Code & Tools

Notify 1.0: Send Notifications to Various Messaging Services ‚Äî Supports about thirty different services including Discord, AWS SES and SNS, Microsoft Teams, Slack, and¬†Telegram.

Niko K√∂ser

Boost Your Go App Security with FusionAuth: Try Our Example¬†SDKs ‚Äî Explore real-world example apps to integrate secure user management into your Go¬†projects.

FusionAuth sponsor

üîí¬†govulncheck 1.1: Find Vulnerable Dependencies in Your Go¬†Code ‚Äî Govulncheck uses static analysis on your code, along with the Go Vulnerability Database, to report relevant known vulnerabilities to you. There‚Äôs an official tutorial on how to use it¬†too.

Julie Qiu (Go Security Team)

LinDB: A Go-Powered Time Series Database System ‚Äî Joining a long line of Go-powered database systems comes LinDB, a new performance and availability-focused time-series database that can be accessed via a REST API. GitHub¬†repo.

Lin Labs Inc.

Kratos 2.8: A Go Framework for Cloud-Based Microservices ‚Äî A ‚Äúmicroservice-oriented governance framework‚Äù built around¬†HTTP/gRPC.

Kratos

  • go-redis 9.6 ‚Äì Redis client¬†library. v9.6 adds support for hash field expiration commands as introduced in Redis¬†7.4.

  • go-resiliency 1.7 ‚Äì Resiliency patterns for¬†Go. Circuit-breaker, deadline¬†&¬†more.

  • Permify 0.10 ‚Äì Google Zanzibar-inspired¬†authorization.

  • Buf 1.35 ‚Äì CLI tool for working with Protocol¬†Buffers.

  • Delve 1.23 ‚Äì Popular debugging tool for Go¬†code.

item.title: „ÄêIt's about time„ÄëÊòØÊó∂ÂÄô‰∫Ü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã515 ‚Äî July 16, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Quartz: A Deterministic Time Testing Library ‚Äî A new mocking library designed for testing code that relies on time, by introducing a little determinism and control to proceedings.. GitHub¬†repo.

Spike Curtis

Go Range Iterators Demystified ‚Äî In Go 1.22 (behind a flag) or 1.23 (currently in the release candidate stage), you can use the range keyword to iterate over custom collection types. Zach walks (iterates?) us through from the basics up to some more complex¬†examples.

Zach Musgrave

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2B¬†SaaS ‚Äî Start selling to enterprise customers with just a few lines of code. WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes. It's used by hundreds of high-growth startups including Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, &¬†Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

Building a Binary Search Tree with SIMD and Go's Assembler ‚Äî When you want a little more performance than Go provides naturally, or access to underlying CPU features unavailable in Go, leaning on assembly language is one way to do it. Cl√©ment shows a practical example¬†here.

Cl√©ment Jean

‚ö†Ô∏è Note that the tutorial above assumes knowledge of Go's assembler and doesn‚Äôt walk through the build process. I‚Äôve put together the pieces of Cl√©ment‚Äôs code into a single GitHub Gist to make it easier to reproduce for yourself,¬†though.

IN BRIEF:

  • The oft (and fairly)-criticized TIOBE Index of programming langauge popularity has had an update with Go moving up to 7th place, after only entering the top 10 earlier this year. A big relative jump, even if you question the¬†methodology.

  • üéß Mat Ryer went on the Go Time podcast to talk about how he builds HTTP services in Go nowadays, after 13 years of doing just¬†that.

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Give Your Go App 'Superpowers' with an Embedded NATS¬†Server ‚Äî NATS is a lightweight real-time client/server messaging system, but a cool feature of NATS is you can embed it directly into a Go app and take advantage of its features without relying on a separate¬†server.

Synadio

Profiling in Go: A Practical Guide ‚Äî Pinpoint performance bottlenecks in your apps by profiling their activity and optimizing things based on the¬†results.

Noam Yadgar

Kafka Is Dead, Long Live Kafka ‚Äî Kafka is polarizing, yet ubiquitous. What if you could run Kafka as a single, stateless Go binary and reduce your¬†costs?

WarpStream sponsor

üìÑ Mastering SOLID Principles with Go Examples Alex Pliutau

üìÑ Docker Best Practices: Choosing Between RUN, CMD, and ENTRYPOINT Jay Schmidt (Docker)

üìÑ Demystifying Go Strings Andrei Boar

üõ† Code & Tools

Fyne 2.5: GUI App Framework for Desktop, Mobile and Web ‚Äî Fyne isn‚Äôt a new project, but it‚Äôs been years since we featured it, and it‚Äôs a pretty neat way to build GUI and mobile apps with Go. v2.5 is a big release with support for Wayland as well as internationalization. It requires Go 1.19+. GitHub¬†repo.

Fyne Team

üí° In Writing GUI apps doesn't have to be painful, Nikola Ubaviƒá explains how he considered numerous languages and GUI app development approaches before settling on Go and¬†Fyne¬†(above).

Minigrad: Andrej Karpathy's Micrograd in Go ‚Äî A neural network library using an autograd approach. It‚Äôs essentially Andrej Karpathy‚Äôs (previously of OpenAI) Micrograd implementation in Go, rather than¬†Python.

Jeet

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meetings should be more like code reviews. We're building a product for that and looking for software leaders to join the beta. Apply here.

üõ°Ô∏è Protect your application infrastructure running on AWS with this time tested and essential security checklist. Download now!

üé•¬†Iris seeks Sr. Backend Engineer for edge-deployed Go/Rust dev. Work on an AI-powered robotic camera platform. Remote, equity, competitive pay.

Build Tools for Go ‚Äî If the out-of-the-box build tools aren‚Äôt getting it done, here‚Äôs list of open source build tools to consider, including Mage and Taskfile.

Inkmi

Chiko: An Elegant gRPC TUI Client ‚Äî Uses the popular tview terminal UI widget library to offer a way to interact with gRPC¬†services.

felangga

timediff: Produce Human Readable, Relative Time Differences ‚Äî For example: timediff.TimeDiff(time.Now().Add(-3 * time.Minute)) would produce ‚Äú3 minutes¬†ago‚Äù.

MergeStat

  • phonenumbers 1.4 ‚Äì Go port of Google's libphonenumber library.

  • gocron 2.10 ‚Äì Run Go functions at pre-determined¬†intervals.

  • go-github 63.0 ‚Äì GitHub v3 API client¬†library.

  • fq 0.12 ‚Äì Like jq for binary¬†formats.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã518 ‚Äî August 6, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

üèñÔ∏è Hi! We're taking next week off for a brief summer break. We'll be back with our next issue on August 20. Also, if possible, can you click an item or two? We're going to be doing some 'list cleaning' soon and it's helpful to know if you're still keen to receive the newsletter¬†‚Äì thanks!¬†:-)
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

Go Weekly

Russ Cox Steps Down as Tech Lead of Go ‚Äî Russ has been instrumental in many of Go‚Äôs developments having led the project for 12 years, but it‚Äôs time for a change with Austin Clements taking his position. But Russ isn‚Äôt leaving the Go world. Indeed, he's already deep into a new project (see¬†next)..

Russ Cox

Oscar: An Open-Source Contributor Agent Architecture ‚Äî As Russ steps away as Go tech lead, he‚Äôs stepping into more work on Oscar, an AI agent system to help maintain open-source projects. The first bot, Gaby, is already up and running on Go‚Äôs issue tracker, with more to¬†come.

Russ Cox

Go! Unlock Your Tech Potential with Ardan Labs Consulting ‚Äî Struggling with skill gaps, development speed or complex tech challenges? Ardan Labs specializes in Go, Rust, Docker and K8s to accelerate your software development, optimize architecture, and manage tech debt. Let us supercharge your¬†team!

Ardan Labs Consulting sponsor

What's the Best Static Analysis Tool for Go? ‚Äî Static analysis can be a valuable part of an app‚Äôs quality toolchain, run by both developers and pipelines. But there are many options, official and otherwise, so which to choose? The answer is (kinda) all of¬†them‚Ä¶?

Nick Tobey (DoltHub)

A 10 Week Go Backend Engineer Onboarding Plan ‚Äî Stream has published the onboarding program they use for Go developers, which covers the basics of Go, databases, HTTP, and more. This is a great idea and sets expectations if you‚Äôre looking for¬†work.

Stream

Did You Know About Instruments? ‚Äî Instruments is a macOS app that allows you to create various traces and profiles of running applications. It offers quite the toolset, as indicated by Thorsten‚Äôs palpable¬†enthusiasm.

Thorsten Ball

Implementing HTTP/0.9 from Scratch ‚Äî The first instalment of a ‚ÄúHTTP from Scratch‚Äù series digging into the history of the protocol underpinning the¬†Web.

Kevin McDonald

üì∫ 5 Levels of Go Error Handling RageCageCodes

üõ† Code & Tools

approf: A Native macOS App for pprof ‚Äî An app experience for viewing the results from pprof profiling that includes drag/drop, reordering, light/dark mode, and saved¬†sessions.

Moderato

Glamour: Stylesheet-based Markdown Rendering for Your CLI¬†Apps ‚Äî Glamour lets you render simple Markdown from your app but then have styles applied to it so that it looks more colorful and elegant once it lands in the¬†terminal. Another great piece of work from the folks at Charm.

Charm

Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

Render sponsor

mimetype: Library for Detecting MIME Types and Extensions ‚Äî Supporting 173 different types, you pass in binary data, a data stream or filename and, hopefully, find out what type of data you‚Äôre working¬†with.

Gabriel Vasile

go-sqlbuilder: A Flexible SQL String Builder Library ‚Äî Originally focused on MySQL and Postgres, it now supports SQL Server, SQLite, CQL, and more, too. Lets you use structs as a ‚Äòlight weight ORM‚Äô, and now also supports Common Table Expression and¬†ILIKE.

Huan Du

Minimock: A Tool to Generate Mocks from Interface Declarations ‚Äî Generates statically typed mocks and helpers, is fully integrated with the testing package, and supports¬†generics.

Juno Inc.

  • River 0.11 ‚Äì Fast and reliable Postgres-powered background jobs for¬†Go.

  • env 11.2 ‚Äì Zero dependency way to parse env variables into¬†structs.

  • Dgraph 24.0 - Native GraphQL database with a graph¬†backend.

  • üáØüáµ Kagome 2.10 ‚Äì Japanese morphological¬†analyzer.

  • Resty 2.14 ‚Äì Simple HTTP and REST client¬†library.

  • webdav 5.1 ‚Äì Standalone WebDAV¬†server.

  • GoBGP 3.29 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

As mentioned earlier, we're taking a week off and will be back on August 20.

If you didn't find anything to click in this issue, how about enjoying ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†this¬†particularly high quality 1950s-themed attempt at the classic Steamed Hams gag from The Simpsons? üòÑ

„Äê

#‚Äã517 ‚Äî July 30, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Cogent Core: A New GUI Framework for Go ‚Äî A new GUI framework with a ‚Äúcode once and run everywhere‚Äù promise for multiple platforms. It aims to be simpler to use than Gio and more powerful than Fyne. Curiously, Cogent‚Äôs web site itself is built in the framework and compiled to WASM to work on the Web. There‚Äôs also ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†a quick screencast pitching you on the¬†framework.

Kai O'Reilly and Randy O'Reilly

Go Features by Version (or What's in Which Go) ‚Äî A list of features and the versions in which they first appeared. Proof, if any were needed, that the progress made to Go isn't slowing down. (And if you want to get up to speed with Go 1.23, here are the notes for¬†you.)

Anton Zhiyanov

Render is Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Whatever your stack you can build, deploy quickly, update and confidently scale your apps with ease, from the first to the billionth user. Start building with Render for free ‚Äî the modern cloud for¬†devs.

Render sponsor

Build Your Own SMTP Server in Go ‚Äî The actual code here isn‚Äôt low level, but it's a good practical guide to some of the technologies around sending e-mail, like SMTP, DKIM, and SPF. The go-smtp library ultimately does the heavy¬†lifting.

Alexis Bouchez

What‚Äôs New in Go 1.23: Iterators and reflect.Value.Seq ‚Äî Carlana explains four of the functions around generic custom iteration that she proposed, comparing the new code to something she wrote ten(!) years ago using channels. If 2022 was all about generics, is 2024 the year of¬†iterators?

Carlana Johnson

Learn Go with Tests: A Refactoring Checklist ‚Äî The popular Learn Go with Tests guide gains a new chapter that gets you thinking about refactoring, when it makes sense to do it, and some of the basic¬†techniques.

Chris James

The Union of Finite Automata, Explained ‚Äî Tim found existing explanations to be overly academic, so set out to explain the concept with a little¬†Go.

Tim Bray

Merge Go Code 10x Faster at Quality with AI-Driven Code¬†Reviews ‚Äî AI-first pull request reviewer that offers context-aware, line-by-line feedback and smart chat. Get a 7-day free trial. Free for OSS¬†projects.

CodeRabbit sponsor

üìÑ Parsing Protobuf Definitions with Tree-sitter ‚Äì If you need to go a few steps beyond what protoc can¬†do. Karl Matthias

üìÑ Highlights from Git 2.46 Taylor Blau (GitHub)

üõ† Code & Tools

Ollama 0.3: Quickly Run Large Language Models ‚Äî Ollama is an increasingly significant Go-powered tool in the LLM world (that uses llama.cpp behind the scenes) that makes it easy to run large language models. Recent releases have added concurrency, Llama 3.1 support, and, now, tool¬†calling.

Ollama Team

betteralign 0.5: Make Your Programs Use Less Memory.. Maybe ‚Äî A tool to detect structs that could use less memory. It‚Äôs a fork of Go‚Äôs fieldalignment tool that skips generated or test files, skips specially marked structs or those with anonymous fields, doesn‚Äôt drop comments, and similar DX¬†enhancements.

Dinko Korunic

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üö®Prevent data breaches before they happen! Secure your Go app on AWS with LocalOps‚Äô proven AWS security checklist. Download now and protect your data instantly!

Boost your PostgreSQL skills with Redgate‚Äôs 101 webinar series of easy-to-follow, expert hosted sessions. It‚Äôs PostgreSQL, simplified.

‚öôÔ∏é Zeppelin ‚Äì A Go-powered Minecraft 1.21 server. ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù asks the README. ‚ÄúWhy not,‚Äù comes the¬†reply. Various Contributors

‚öôÔ∏é Reed-Solomon ‚Äì Fast Reed-Solomon erasure¬†coding. Klaus Post

‚öôÔ∏é Circumflex ‚Äì A terminal UI for Hacker News. Ben Sadeh

  • FerretDB 1.23 ‚Äì It's like MongoDB, but on top of Postgres or¬†SQLite.

  • go-yaml 1.12.0 ‚Äì YAML processing for Go with more¬†features.

  • Baur 5.0 ‚Äì Go-powered incremental task runner for¬†monorepos.

  • eBPF 0.16 ‚Äì Pure-Go library to work with eBPF¬†programs.

  • Goa 3.18 ‚Äì DSL for building¬†microservices.

üéÅ And one for fun..

Editor: A Source Code Editor in Pure Go ‚Äî Curiously billing itself as a ‚Äúsimple but advanced source code editor‚Äù, it works on Linux, Windows and macOS (under X server) and certainly has that old school Unix vibe going¬†on. Clearly a serious labor of love after some seven years of¬†development.

Jorge Miguel Pinto
